page.title: 07Home Farm And Charalais Herd
page.content: This 110 Strong Herd of pedigree Charalais cattle are managed by Mr Rugg, store manager for Mr and Mrs Lyster. Charalais cows are white and originate from France. The breed was introduced into this country by Colonel Lancaster in 1966. In their first few weeks the bull calves have their horns removed and rings put in their noses, so they can be controlled easily. A bull can grow to about one and a half tons. Their biggest bull is called Thunder. The cattle are shown regulary at shows like the Royal & the Highland. They win many prizes. Preperation for the shows takes six months. When a show is near bulls are cleaned, washed shampooed and dried. One bull recently sold for Â£6500. These cows are special as they have quick growing and lean meat.
